title: Account Manager Job at International Flavors & Fragrances
content:
International Flavors & Fragrances is an industry leader in food, beverage, health, biosciences and sensorial experiences, where science and creativity meet to create essential solutions for a better world – from global icons to unexpected innovations and experiences. With the beauty of art and the precision of science, we are an international collection of thinkers who partner with customers to bring scents, tastes, experiences, ingredients and solutions for products the world craves. Together, we will do more good for people and planet.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Account Manager
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Requisition ID: R9666
Job Location: Lagos
Job type: Full time (On-site)

Job Summary


	Responsible for driving sustainable profitable sales and market share growth by identifying the customer needs and opportunities, establishing solid customer relationship, leading, coordinating and reporting IFF activities and promoting relevant solutions aligned with corporate strategy. For a defined territory, category, coordinated or global account:
	Ensure financial targets are met and business performance is constantly monitored and reported;
	Develop and maintain sustainable relationships with internal and external customers; prepare account plan and report relevant market information;
	Collaborate with internal departments to explore innovations and new concepts related to customers’ products and on-going projects;
	Monitor market development in terms of competitors, products, and trends; partner with operation team to ensure customer satisfaction in terms of service, quality, and supply.
	Understand Food Ingredients market and customer ecosystem including activities, strategies, brands, markets
	Develop multi-level cross-functional customer relationships with key customer decision makers/influencers
	Contribute/lead commercial negotiations (e.g., core listing, annual pricing, payment terms, rebates/cost savings agreements, supply contracts)
	Maximize potential advantage to IFF while delivering optimal solutions to customer (GP improvement, catalogue optimization, complexity reduction, etc.)
	Ensure customer supply chain requirements, processes and KPIs are well communicated to IFF Operations to ensure we meet customer needs
	Understand customer regulatory requirements/changes
	Acts as the main customer point of contact in all matters
	Demonstrate IFF Culture Principles and live our values
	Influencing stakeholders to align on shared objectives
	Lead projects through effective communication, and collaboration with key external and internal stakeholders

	Build and execute account plans successfully

	Effectively communicate the account plans with stakeholders including internal and external team members
	Review/update the progress of account plans versus KPI targets
	Ensure accurate monthly sales forecast to allow for effective operations planning and financial analysis
	Conduct retrospective reviews on projects wins and losses

	Essential: Bachelor’s Degree / ND Food Technology / Food Science / B.Sc.

Experience:


	Approximately +7 years of experience in sales in the Food Ingredients industry
	Strong track record in commercial


Skills:

	Analytical with the ability to deal with financial concepts/processes(pricing/margin/forecasting)
	Creative and innovative thinking
	Project management with effective collaboration and orchestration skills
	Strong communication, presentation, storytelling, and negotiation skills
	Effective business English with a global mindset and ability to work with different cultures
	Ability to gather and leverage competitive market intelligence

title: Marketing Operations Manager Job at Chellarams Nigeria Plc
content:
Chellarams Nigeria Plc is the pioneering group that brought KFC to Nigeria, brings another top retail brand to the country. Do you imagine working for a company that is one of the best, trusted and respected African retail brand? Now is your opportunity. 

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Marketing Operations Manager
Job Location: Isolo, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Department: Marketing
Reports To: Head of Marketing

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a detail-oriented and highly organized Marketing Operations Manager to be a cornerstone of our newly reactivated marketing department. This role will be instrumental in the execution and optimization of B2B marketing initiatives specifically for Chellarams Plc, Dynamic Industries Limited, and United Technical & Allied Services Limited.
	You will focus on building efficient processes, managing marketing technology, and ensuring the smooth operation of digital and traditional campaigns that contribute to brand awareness, lead generation, and overall marketing effectiveness across our diverse B2B product lines (Air Compressors, Material Handling, Chemicals, and Shrink/Stretch Wrap).
	This is a foundational role, ideal for someone eager to build systems and contribute directly to establishing a robust marketing framework within a developing digital landscape.


Key Responsibilities (Year 1 Focus)


	Marketing Infrastructure & Process Management: Assist the Head of Marketing in setting up and managing core marketing systems and processes (e.g., CRM integration, marketing automation workflows, and email templates). Ensure seamless operation and data flow across various marketing tools. Contribute to establishing best practices for digital asset management and campaign execution
	Email Marketing Operations: Manage the end-to-end operational aspects of B2B email marketing campaigns (newsletters, promotional emails, product updates, event invitations). This includes list segmentation, deployment scheduling, and ensuring data accuracy and compliance within the newly established CRM. Monitor campaign performance (open rates, click-through rates, conversions) and provide detailed reports
	Digital Presence Management (B2B Focus): Take a lead role in the day-to-day management and optimisation of the company's LinkedIn Company Pages for B2B engagement, including rectifying the UTAS profile to a company page and establishing a presence for Dynamic Industries. Assist with content scheduling, performance tracking, and identifying opportunities for improvement across all B2B social media. Support content updates, maintenance, and basic SEO optimization of the company's B2B websites (Chellarams Plc, UTAS, and the new Dynamic Industries site).
	Promotional & Collateral Production: Coordinate the design, production, inventory, and distribution of B2B promotional items (e.g., brochures, flyers, giveaways, exhibition materials). Ensure all marketing collateral adheres to brand guidelines. Manage relationships with suppliers for printing and merchandise.
	Event Logistical Support: Provide comprehensive logistical support for B2B events, trade shows, and webinars. This includes assisting with pre-event promotions, attendee registration, material preparation, and post-event follow-up.
	Marketing Data & Reporting: Track marketing expenses and budgets. Assist in gathering, analysing, and reporting on the performance of various B2B marketing campaigns and activities, contributing to the development of regular marketing performance reports for the Head of Marketing.
	Administrative Support: Provide general administrative support to the Marketing Department as required, ensuring marketing calendars and deadlines are managed effectively.


Current Digital Presence Landscape:


	Websites: Chellarams Plc and United Technical & Allied Services (UTAS) currently maintain existing websites that need significant updates and optimisation. Dynamic Industries Limited, however, lacks a dedicated online presence, with only a rudimentary landing page hosted within the Chellarams Plc website; a new, standalone website is required for Dynamic Industries.
	Social Media: The group's social media presence is inconsistent and requires substantial development.
	LinkedIn: While Chellarams Plc has an established company page with approximately 2,000 followers, UTAS's presence is limited to a personal profile that needs to be formally converted into an official company page. Dynamic Industries Limited currently has no official LinkedIn presence.
	Instagram: Only UTAS maintains an Instagram account, which is largely inactive, showing only six posts and three followers, with the last update dating back to August 2023.
	Facebook: The group has no official corporate presence on Facebook, with the only activity being related to the NCCES initiative (a CSR Foundation).
	WhatsApp Business: There are currently no official WhatsApp Business accounts established for any of the businesses within the group.
	CRM: A CRM solution for the three businesses is currently being selected and implemented; this role will assist with its integration and ongoing use from a marketing operations perspective.
	Lead Generation: Existing lead generation is primarily through sales teams performing customer mapping and obtaining direct introductions through the corporate leadership team.


Qualification
Essential:


	Diploma or Degree in Marketing, Business Administration or a related field, OR equivalent demonstrable professional experience.
	3-5 years of experience in a marketing support, coordinator, or operations role, preferably within a B2B environment, with experience in a developing or foundational marketing function.
	Demonstrable familiarity with digital marketing concepts (SEO, SEM, social media marketing, email marketing platforms).
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).


Desirable:


	Experience with specific CRM or marketing automation platforms (e.g., HubSpot, Salesforce).
	Strong analytical skills with experience in basic data reporting.
	Experience managing supplier relationships.
	Understanding of brand consistency principles.


Core Competencies & Soft Skills:


	Organisational Excellence: Highly organised with meticulous attention to detail, capable of managing multiple tasks and deadlines in a dynamic environment.
	Problem-Solving: Proactive in identifying and resolving operational challenges.
	Collaboration: Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to work effectively within a team and coordinate with various stakeholders.
	Communication: Excellent written and verbal communication skills for clear internal and external interactions.
	Adaptability: Eager to learn and adapt to new technologies and processes in a developing department, comfortable with building systems from scratch.
	Initiative: A self-starter who can work independently and take ownership of tasks, demonstrating a proactive approach to operational improvements.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@chellaramsplc.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: Senior Software Engineer - Packaging - Optimize Ubuntu Server Job at Canonical Nigeria
content:
(adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    

Canonical - We deliver open source to the world faster, more securely, and more cost-effectively than any other company. We develop Ubuntu, the world’s most popular enterprise Linux from cloud to edge, together with a passionate global community of 200,000 contributors. Ubuntu means 'humanity to others. We chose it because it embodies the generosity at the heart of open source, the new normal for platforms and innovation. Together with a community of 200,000, we publish an operating system that runs from the tiny connected devices up to the world's biggest mainframes, the platform that everybody uses on the public cloud, and the workstation experience of the world's most productive developers. Secure and reliable, elegant and intuitive, and open for innovation - Ubuntu is the future of open source, which is why it's the fastest-growing Linux in the world despite already being the most widely deployed.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Senior Software Engineer - Packaging - Optimize Ubuntu Server

Job Location: Lagos
Job type: Full time

The role entails


	Collaborating proactively within a distributed team
	Fostering a software ecosystem with seamless user experience for all Ubuntu users
	Evaluating contributions of other engineers to maintain high-quality software standards.
	Playing a role in shaping the future of Ubuntu via both - new ideas in your areas of interest and advising on work being done elsewhere
	Collaborating with other teams in the Ubuntu and Debian communities, with upstream projects, and commercially supported customers
	Owning the maintenance of Ubuntu Server packages. Specifically but not limited to:
	
		Traditional server workloads (web servers, databases, network services, etc)
		Virtualisation and Containers
		Package management and dependencies
		Language runtimes and toolchains
		Work from home with global travel 2 to 4 weeks for internal and external events
	
	


What we are looking for in you


	You have a Bachelor’s or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree (or any higher) or equivalent professional experience (5+ years of professional experience).
	You love technology and working with brilliant people
	You are curious, flexible, articulate, and accountable
	You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated
	Interest or experience in open source maintenance or contributions
	Able to replay complex workloads and systems. Able to write detailed test plans and reproducibility steps.
	Feel comfortable contributing and debugging many languages such as C/C++, Python, Rust, Go, Ruby, PHP
	Experience in packaging in one or more ecosystems. This could be language specific systems (Python wheels, Rust Crates, Go Modules, or other equivalent) or any distro package format (deb, rpm, NixOS, or other equivalent).
	Experience using and creating containers and virtual machines.


What we offer colleagues


	We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide.
	We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance.
	In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus.
	We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals.
	We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
	Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
	Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
	Annual compensation review
	Recognition rewards
	Annual holiday leave
	Maternity and paternity leave
	Employee Assistance Programme
	Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
	Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company
